Sam Aaron has just returned from his visit to these deep, underground Burgundian cellars and reports “the quiet, tomb-like darkness, the endless rows of ‘sleeping beauty’ bottles were covered thick with cobwebs—I shall never forget the experience—the most rewarding and dramatic of my lifetime of wine tasting.”

WHO IS DR. ALBERT BAROLET? Research reveals that he was a distinguished son of an old, respected Bur- gundian family, who recently died at the age of 71. Dr. Barolet was considered one of the most distinguished physicians of the Burgundy area. At the time of his death last year, he had already retired from his practice of psychiatry, devoting full time to his beloved passion, col- lecting the great wines of Burgundy. His name had be- come legend among the wine lovers of the continent — many would make annual pilgrimages to Beaune, tasting his treasures, and bringing back choice bottles to add lustre to their own wine collection.

“What can a vintner buy one half so precious as the stuff he sells?”. Dr. Barolet found the answer—“more wine.”

THIS OCCASION MARKS THE FIRST TIME that Dr. Barolet’s collection has crossed the Atlantic, their aged virtues now becoming available to the wine lovers here. Their authenticity, greatness and longevity have been testified to by Dr. Barolet’s friends and wine clients in such countries as France, Belgium and Switzerland—and now America has an opportunity to render its verdict.

HERE IS A UNIQUE opportunity to bring the glory of Burgundy to the holiday table, whether it be as a gift to a friend, or for your own wine wonderment.
